Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with green leaves to show it gets enough water and light.
The student can draw a plant with wilting or dry leaves to show it does not get enough water.
The student can draw a plant in a dark place to show it does not get enough light.
The student can use their drawings to show that plants need water and light to live and grow.
The student can draw a comparison to highlight the differences between plants with water and light and those without.
